content:
ICS 269, Winter 2000: Theory Seminar

The theory group meets Fridays at 1:00 in the CS 432/438 conference room.
This quarter's schedule:

7 Jan: - Organizational meeting
14 Jan: Nina Amenta Computational geometry and computer graphics
21 Jan: David Eppstein and Sandy Irani Report from SODA '00
28 Jan: - ICS Research Symposium
4 Feb: David Eppstein Multivariate regression depth
11 Feb: - no theory group
18 Feb: Dave Goggin Data ordering for visualization
25 Feb: Sergey Kirshner On-line load balancing in a hierarchical server topology
3 Mar: Javid Hüseynov Weaving patterns of lines and line segments in space
10 Mar: Mac Casale A polynomial time algorithm for counting protein aggregation packings
17 Mar: George Lueker Packing stretchable bins

Also this quarter, we will have a department seminar of possible interest to the theory group, on geometric visibility problems, by Stephan Eidenbenz, Friday, March 24, at 11AM in CS432.

Previous quarters' theory seminars

David Eppstein
Department of Information and Computer Science
University of California, Irvine, CA 92697-3425
eppstein@ics.uci.edu
Last modified: 6 Mar 2000
